DOCNAME: GALEOTTI OTTIERI DELLA CIAJA AND SIX OTHERS v. ITALY
TEXT: The applicants are CARDINAL NORP nationals , whose names , dates of birth and places of residence are indicated in the attached list .
They are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , CARDINAL lawyers practising in GPE and GPE .
The first CARDINAL applicants are the heirs of a certain PERSON
The amount of main and complementary taxes to be paid on PERSON estate of inheritance was fixed respectively at CARDINAL ORG ( CARDINAL ORG ) and CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ORG ) .

On DATE the first applicant requested the ORG revenue to recalculate the taxes . She observed that in accordance with Rule CARDINAL of Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE , tax rates had been assessed on the estate of inheritance considered as a whole , and not on the heirs’ individual assets , a fact which provoked a difference of treatment between sole heirs and persons being heirs pro quota of substantial estates . The first applicant noted in particular that under the above system , assuming that the estate amounted to CARDINAL ORG , the sole heir should pay CARDINAL ORG , while CARDINAL heirs sharing pro quota an estate of CARDINAL ORG should pay CARDINAL ORG each .
The Revenue rejected the first applicant ’s request .

On DATE the first CARDINAL applicants and a certain PERSON introduced a claim before ORG . They alleged , inter alia , that Rule CARDINAL of Presidential Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE was contrary to Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , guaranteeing the principle of equality of treatment and providing that everybody should contribute to public expenses in relation to his or her taxable capacity .
In a decision of DATE , ORG , observing that on DATE ORG had declared manifestly ill - founded an exception similar to the CARDINAL raised by the applicants , rejected the claim .
Invoking , inter alia , LAW , taken in conjunction with LAW , the first CARDINAL applicants and PERSON appealed to ORG .
In an order of DATE , ORG confirmed the first - instance decision .

On DATE the first CARDINAL applicants and PERSON introduced a claim before ORG , seeking the withdrawal of ORG decision . They relied on Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW as well as on LAW , taken in conjunction with LAW .

In a judgment of DATE , ORG rejected the ORG claim . It raised doubts as to the binding character of the LAW and noted that , in any case , its provisions could be modified by subsequent ordinary laws . ORG moreover observed that , as ORG had held on a number of occasions , taxes had to be assessed on the basis of the estate of inheritance as a whole , without taking into account the heirs’ individual assets . Therefore , higher tax rates on more substantial estates were a mere consequence of the principle of progressiveness of taxation .
The applicants appealed on points of law , the last CARDINAL applicants acting in their capacity of heirs of PERSON

In a judgment of DATE , filed with the registry on DATE , ORG rejected the ORG appeal . It acknowledged that the LAW provisions were incorporated into NORP law and could not be modified by ordinary laws . ORG moreover accepted that taxation could interfere with the ORG right of property and raise issues under LAW . However , it found no appearance of violation of this provision , given the fact that LAW no . CARDINAL was aimed to ensure an higher fiscal pressure on more substantial estates , thus applying the principle of progressiveness of taxation .
